name: SetGithubReposForRequiredWorkflow
description:
Set repositories for a GitHub required workflow.

This tool sets the repositories associated with a GitHub required workflow. Use it when you need to configure or update which repositories are subject to a required workflow. Authentication with an access token and the `admin:org` scope is required.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The GitHub organization name. Input is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: required_workflow_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the required workflow you want to set for the repositories.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the required workflow.

parameters.name: repository_ids_for_required_workflow
parameters.description: An array of repository IDs for which the workflow is required. Provide each repository's ID as an integer.

value_schema.description: The IDs of the repositories for which the workflow should be required.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: required_workflow_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the required workflow.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the required workflow.

parameters.name: selected_repository_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the repositories for which the workflow should be required.

value_schema.description: The IDs of the repositories for which the workflow should be required.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
